page.title: 09FRANKLEY - ATTITUDES & VIEWS
page.content: Most of the families coming to the Frankley area from Birmingham have been here for five to ten years.They like the area's closeness to the countryside and yet be within easy reach of the city.They recognise the problems such as teenage boredom leading to violence,graffitti and petty crime.To help combat this the area has the only community policeman based in a high school in the country.The people have a variety of views on things which would improve the estate;increased sports and leisure facilities such as a B.M.X. track,swimming pool or cinema to occupy young people.They would like to see more parks and open spaces for families to use.They want better transport and shopping facilities and something done to remove graffitti and litter to improve the environment.
